{{dcl begin}}
{{dcl|since=c++20|
constexpr std::ptrdiff_t max() noexcept;
}}
{{dcl end}}

Returns the internal counter's maximum possible value, which is greater than or equal to {{tt|LeastMaxValue}}.

===Return value===
The internal counter's maximum possible value, as a {{lc|std::ptrdiff_t}}.

===Notes===
For specialization {{tt|binary_semaphore}}, {{tt|LeastMaxValue}} is equal to {{c|1}}.

As its name indicates, the {{tt|LeastMaxValue}} is the ''minimum'' max value, not the ''actual'' max value. Thus {{c|max()}} can yield a number larger than {{tt|LeastMaxValue}}.
